drug.name: Penimepicycline
drug.description: Penimepicycline is a tetracycline-class antibiotic. It is mentioned on List A produced by the Government of Canada, which is a list of antimicrobial active pharmaceutical ingredients [L2791]. In the classification of the active ingredients included on this list, the classification document states that tetracycline class antibiotics are of medium importance, and are used in humans [L5620].

link.title: Categorizing Antimicrobials on List A Government of Canada

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as tetracyclines. These are polyketides having an octahydrotetracene-2-carboxamide skeleton, substituted with many hydroxy and other groups.

drug-interaction.name: Succinylcholine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Succinylcholine can be increased when used in combination with Penimepicycline.
